So, the person sleeping on the inside might need to be “flexible” in climbing up to bed ! Bathroom is small but ok; liked the strong water pressure and the instant hot water! Loved the heated WC seat and its electrically controlled bidet function! Space in the room was small and if you organize your bags properly, should be good for 2 cabin sized luggages. Anything more or bigger, you might have a problem unless you don’t mind opening and closing your luggages and store them upright each time you use them. Hotel was quite near to a metro station (Higashi-Shinjuku); about 5-10 minutes walk and serviced by the Fukutoshin & Odeo lines which take you directly to Shinjuku main station & Shibuya. Hotel is very near to many nice restaurants all within walking distance and also in close proximity to a red light district & bars/clubs! Front desk staff are generally polite and helpful and can converse in English; except for a male staff on the day of our checkout who wasn’t very helpful. Not sure if it was because he didn’t understand English but when I asked him if I should call for a Grab taxi or an Uber to get to the train station (as it was raining then), he quickly raised both his hands in a surrender gesture and said he can’t help and said that it’s between me and the driver, like as though he didn’t want to take any responsibility if anything goes wrong! Found that quite strange. Otherwise, our family had an enjoyable stay at the Shinjuku Granbell Hotel.

This hotel in Shinjuku was a great choice. We had a top floor suite but this hotel seems to cater for a wide variety of budgets. The checkin was easy, our suite was ready early, which is always appreciated. It was stunning, quirky and worth the extra money. The bathroom included a large bath as well as a shower wet room and good quality toiletries. The hotel rooftop bar is an excellent facility with great views and a happy hour that provides reasonably priced food and cocktails. I loved this hotel, especially the suite and would stay here again for sure. It is a reasonably short walk from the gigantic Shinjuku station, and surrounded by great places to eat and drink.

Hotel is reasonably priced and is located about 15 minutes walk to all the happenings in Shinjuku. Room is small (as with all other Tokyo hotels) but well equipped. Nearest subway station is Higashi Shinjuku which is 5 mins away. Along that stretch of street you’ll find a cafe, convenience store, McDonald’s and a 24 hours eatery that serves really nice local Japanese food.

Clean and the the staff friendly, but the standard room is really small, the roof top bar was our escape to place after a day out. Great views, the location is good, a 15 min walk to station, and although in a busy district our room was quiet.

Indeed nothing fancy, and the rooms are small (but that's everywhere in Tokyo). Breakfast is a major disaster though, unless you prefer lukewarm brewed coffee over a fresh espresso (why is your proper cafe downstairs closed in the morning when guest need it badly???).The one reason I gave it more than 3 stars, though, is your front desk lady, Yumi. She's absolutely the best. How she went above and beyond to help me with something I had forgotten in the hotel is amazing. Thx so much!

Stayed here for 6 nights, the reception staff were always friendly and professional. the room itself was spacious compared to other hotels in Japan. The hotel is very well located you are spoilt with eating places / choices. Metro stations are not too far either. Really enjoyed my stay at the hotel :).

Hotel is clean, front desk were good. Note that this hotel is located in the red light district of Shinjuku. This is not necessarily a problem, this is the most understated red light district you may come across, but is certainly something that they do not advertise. A couple of comments for the hotel; You should allow hotel guests to bring outside food to outdoor bar area on top floor. You could charge a drink minimum. Otherwise rooms were clean and well maintained, albeit they are small even for Japanese standards, but you are not necessarily spending that much time in your room, so it does not really matter.

Great location, amongst everything Shinjuku has to offer. The lead-in rooms are small, if i can redo my stay i would upgrade to the next room type as i had to leave all my luggage at the door way and had to move it each time i left the room. Bathroom was large, with a shower bath combo. The TV had only 1 English channel which is common in Japan. Buffet Breakfast was good, plenty of options but if it isn't complimentary I would not pay extra. The Granbell has a nice rooftop bar but be prepared to pay $$$ for a drink.

Stayed for 4 days in a shoebox sized room that wasn’t worth the money (read expensive for what the overall hotel was). Later in trip when back from other areas stayed at hotel Gracery for same price and way better. First room was very small. 5 inches between twin beds and nothing else to either side. Second, our TV didn’t work. When we asked front desk, they came and checked and advised that yes it didn’t work but that’s the way it was and nothing could be done about it. 3. I bought the package that included the breakfast - DON’T. It really was not worth the money. A good western breakfast offering is hard to come by in Tokyo hotels as an included option (its all about the runny half cooked eggs, fatty ham disguised as bacon, and some toast). 4. Staff really did not speak English well. Everything was a problem, and an attitude. At some times I think perhaps they’d forgotten that I was a paying customer. Good things about this hotel? Well, if you get a deal on booking on a site, the rooms are fairly clean, and the location is fairly central. So if you are simply looking for a reasonably priced place to lay your head because you will be out sightseeing all day, then I guess this would make sense.

We‘re so excited to spend a few more days in Tokyo. But, that was the most unfriendly reception we ever experienced during our entire trip through Japan. Too bad! But not only the staff has a lack of charm, everywhere you feel more like in a youth hostel and not like in a modern 4 star hotel. The photos have nothing in common with reality. Until the Olympics, this place has to be pretty, is a strong competition in this great city!

Well located for transport, rooms cleaned and made up well every day. Nice top floor bar for evening views. Rooms quite small especially as we were there for 7 nights but you know about this before you go and it was a place to sleep and no more. Good vending machine choice!

Just stayed at the Granbell Shinjuku for 4 nights/5 days. Great stay, would recommend. The details:Check in/out: quick, easy, painless.Room: We paid a little more $$ for a deluxe designer room. The room is bigger than their standard rooms, with a more spacious bathroom as well. The deluxe designer is the size of a standard hotel room in the US. The standard rooms in this hotel are quite small, almost claustrophobic. So we're very glad we paid a little more for the extra space. Room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. Comes with free water + beverages daily. No complaints.Food: Breakfast was included with our room. It was convenient, and we went every day, Food is pretty standard. Location: Amazing location. 5 min walk to golden gai, robot restaurant, and the main shinjuku area. Can't beat it. It was great being able to walk back after a night out.My only complaint is that one day, we shared one of our breakfast vouchers with our friends staying at the same hotel. They were denied from breakfast bc their room did not come with a voucher. Still don't see what difference it makes if they used the voucher or if we did -- especially because they were guests at the hotel as well. Management should really reconsider this rule.

If you're passing through Tokyo or on a short trip this hotel will do very nicely. It's close to Shinjuku station and near plenty of bars and restaurants. Some of the bars might not suit everyone's tastes however. The rooms are small though, and I mean small. There are some hangers but no drawers so expect to live out of your suitcase which will be on the floor at the foot of your bed.Wifi is good and the rooftop bar provides nice views.Given the pricing this represents good clean value.

only stay for 1 night but the location of the hotel is very convenience to go to the most busy shopping street, the room may not big but tidy, clean, fresh and modern, but friendly hotel. good for backpack, highly recommend that

Whilst there was nothing wrong with the hotel, it was not quite what I expected from the photos. I would not stay again and here are a few reasons.First of all the positives - the staff were helpful, and the location is fine.The negatives were - even though I had a bigger room it was still small even for japan standards. There was nowhere to unpack my case - I usually like to unpack as soon as I arrive, but instead I had to have the cases on the follow which took up a lot of the space. If there had been 2 people in the room it would have felt claustrophobic.There was no desk or chair in the room - so if you are on a work trip it is hard to actually do any work. The Exec lounge didn't have wifi so if you want to sit and work you have to do that in the lobby and then you end up smelling of the cooked food from the bar. The breakfast was ok - but some more variety and healthier choices would have been nice.I think this is better suited to short stays, and for single travellers.

We stayed at the Economy Double for about 7 days during our last trip to Tokyo and I can say that it was a very pleasant experience.Room is pretty small but good enough for us, because that is what’s expected from an Economy Room in the middle of the city. The room is big enough for couple, so if you got a little kid travelling with you, I suggest you order a bigger room. You got the usual stuffs of course; some tea, coffee, water boiler, safe box and an empty fridge. Yes, they do not have a mini bar, but I’m totally fine with it. You also got two bottles of water each day, if you feel that’s not enough, you can always ask for some more at the cart or you can get one from the vending machine room downstairs. Their amenities can be considered pretty good. You got 2 set of toothbrush, shaver completed with the cream, you also got hair comb, body towels (to rub your back while taking shower), cotton buds, facial cottons and a hair tie! They did not give you a shower cap though. Another thing that I like is that they packed the shampoo, conditioner and body soap in a big bottle instead of tiny ones like most hotels do.I can’t say much about their breakfast/restaurants/bars because we didn’t go for it but staffs here can speak good English and that alone is already a plus. This hotel is also pretty friendly for those in wheelchairs and there’s braille on the elevator too. Another thing that I would like to give note of is the location of the hotel; which is very strategic place in my opinion. While the address does say it is located at the Kabukicho, it is actually not inside of the Kabukicho main district but rather a bit out, so there is no need to worry about noise or crowds, etc. It’s very close to the Higashi-Shinjuku Station (Oedo/Fukutoshin line) that can take you to Shibuya, Harajuku, Ueno, Asakusa etc. However, if you own a JR Pass it is best that you go to the Shinjuku Sanchome Station which is around 15 mins walk from the hotel. It is very close to the Kabukicho Main District, Robot Restaurant, Shinjuku Golden Gai, the famous Godzilla Head as well as Don Quixote. It is also close to Daikoku Drug, Seven Eleven, etc.

The hotel itself is very clean. First time coming to Japan, when we arrived to tokyo station it us ages to find but since then there was bo problem coming from and.to the hotel. 15 min walk from the station. I reccomend using Google Maps as you will not find it without.The check in was fine,we arrieved at 7pm. We got a double economy room, non smoking. The room itself is tiny as expected. The bath was tiny but the shower is powerful. Everyday we got our room cleaned and they did a wiked job of it.They give you water bottles everyday!.The breakfast was the same everyday but was nice. You get western which included chicken nuggets and japanese food. I think they should change the menu once and while.The hotel is located in the red district but you wouldnt tell. It did feel safe for us.Overall I would stay here again but there are better hotels out there!

Stayed here for our last night in Japan, after spending 5 days in Tokyo at the start of our trip based closer to Tokyo station.The location is quite cool - there is a lot to see and do around the hotel. It’s a bit of a walk to transportation; 15mins to Shinjuku Station. Room - we had a delux double and this was a decent size for the two of us and our luggage. A comfy queen bed, good pillows and a small couch for extra space to sit. The bathroom is reasonable, a large bath than most other Japanese hotel rooms.Blackout blinds and controllable AC were great.Rooftop bar is worth a visit. ¥500 cover charge is waived when you show your room key. Nothing amazing drinks wise, but the view is great and cheap beer during happy hour. Breakfast was fairly stock standard, pleasant and filled the spot.

The good:The location was good. About 15 minutes walking distance from the Shinjuku train station. Not amazing but still acceptable walking distance.The lobby was stylish and modern.The not so good:The room was not very clean. We booked an economy room so we were prepared to stay in a tiny room - we had that in other hotels all over Japan. But that does not justify the fact that parts of the room was covered with dust in some areas.Also, it felt like the room was not aired enough, perhaps due to the fact that it was not possible to open the window.In the breakfast area there was no wifi available for guest.The staff was polite and correct but not very friendly (when compared with other hotels in Tokyo and other cities in Japan).

We really enjoyed our stay at Granbell. We stayed here for a week. The location is excellent, and only a few minutes walk to the closest train station. The staff spoke perfect english and were extremely helpful. The rooms are modern, clean and comfortable albeit on the small side, but this seems to be par for the course in Japan. This might not be of any relevance to most, but being here for a week, we appreciated that the hotel had CNN as many of our other hotels did not have any english news channels. I recommend this hotel to visitors to Tokyo.

The hotel was within walking distance of the heart of Tokyo. The location was great for walking and had access to other parts of the town away from Shinjuku. The rooms were on the smaller side but still really comfortable (from my understanding they were the same as most hotels in Tokyo). The roof top bar was really nice with great drinks and food. The atmosphere was great and it had really helpful staff. The lobby was full of people waiting to check in most days which was a little frustrating but apart from that we love our stay here.

After researching for hours on Tokyo hotels I was getting pretty disheartened at the price of things and what you could get. Decided to splash out and book this hotel as only in town for 3 nights and wanted a quality experience. Rather then pay slightly less for a mediocre hotel or wayyyy more for a high end - this is a good in the middle (but still high) Service is not that of a 5star large hotel but really all you need is a good room and breakfast which this hotel delivers. We booked a club room - designer deluxe and it was deff worth it as the room had floor to ceiling windows with a great view and layout was good with a sofa and bed and great bathroom. our friends were in a room on a lower floor and said it was tiny so i was pleased we had the room we did. Club lounge was small and not that inviting so didn't bother but free beer if you want one! Breakfast was fairly good, not very often rotated but plenty of choices. Location is good, a small walk to the station and plenty of entertainment nearby. All very safe and no issues getting around. Make sure you visit Shibuya backstreets.

We booked the Granbell for a few nights after a cruise. It's a great hotel to stay at due to the location and access to public transportation. It's also a great location to explore the business of Shinjuku. It's a very international hotel - we heard every language in the lobby. We stayed in a Superior Designer Double studio and appreciated the extra space. We enjoyed breakfast each morning and had drinks in the bar one happy hour. The weather prevented us from enjoying the rooftop patio. We did not spend a ton of time in the room because we were out exploring, so this hotel met our needs perfectly.

Hotel is in a great location with a main station close by...in the heart of it all but not noisey, clean effiecent and has handy travel phones to take out with you.Great roof top bar and staff very polite.It does take a bit of finding on day one. But once you have sussed your way you wont believe how vlose to everything it is.

This was a lovely, clean hotel with very friendly staff. The rooftop bar and restaurant had great views, especially at night. The breakfast was delicious, with a wide variety of choices. We had a loft room for the three of us, not much room for suitcases but still comfortable. A very easy walk to the main part of Shinjuku as well.

This is a large, busy, well functioning hotel with no space wasted. The foyer area often has luggage standing around and people checking in and out but we arrived and departed with a feeling of a well managed guest in a well run hotel.We booked and were prepared for a small room. We were impressed with how well this space was utilized. All the features that make a hotel room comfortable including a bar fridge were provided.The breakfast was extensive with both eastern and western tastes catered for. The breakfast room on the 12th floor afforded great views over Shinjuku.The bar with an outside terrace on the floor above was well appointed and served drinks and bar food to a crowd that enjoyed the views. There is also a restaurant at this level.We really appreciated the complementary "Handy" smart phone that was provided in the room. This device guided us through our excursions into Tokyo. It helped in finding and guiding us to venues for shopping, eating and sight seeing. It also affords the user free local and international calls to some countries.Although this hotel is not right next to a metro station it is in easy walking distance from various metro lines and very close to the centre of Shinjuku.I would recommend this hotel and certainly return to it in future visits.

Loved this hotel, great location, excellent breakfast, room’s are small as most in Japan. Friendly English speaking staff. Good value for the money. Highly recommend for the ‘adventure traveler’. LGBT friendly and conveniently close to Shinjuku rail station.

I always review hotels I stay in by what I would expect from the Stars they are. This hotel is a 4 star on some sites and only a 3 on trip advisor. I’ve been in considerably better 2 star hotels!Location is possibly the only good thing about this hotel. Our room was small but I expect that in Japan and we were in the economy double. Compact true but that meant, other than four hangers in a small cupboard by the door, we could not unpack for our four night stay. But it was clean and we slept well. Also tea and nice coffee in room too. We bought some fresh milk and orange juice from local store and kept in fridge in room.All staff spoke English but I found the staff to be a little abrupt and unhelpful. At check in they gave no extra info like all other hotels I have stayed in usually do regarding breakfast, concierge, info etc. I literally signed a form and they handed us our key cards and walked away to do something else. Didn’t even point out where the lifts were. We later found some info leaflets tucked behind one of the pillars in the foyer. Looks like info in a library all tucked into plastic folders. Not overly welcoming. I tried to ask about using a taxi to take us to Shinjuku station as we’d booked the Narita Express train back to airport. Weather looked wet so we thought a taxi might be easier than the 15 minute walk. But I queued for over 5 minutes at what I thought was a concierge desk only to be told to go queue with all the hundreds of people checking in! I only wanted to ask a quick question. We walked to station in the end as couldn’t be bothered to find out information from anyone else. The foyer feels oppressive and dark. There were always cases all over the place and because it is quite a thin, long space when it was busy at check out or check in times, we were weaving through people to get to the door. I believe this hotel likes to call itself a stylish hotel but this, in my opinion, is lacking. Even though we were not told any info about adding breakfast to our stay we did check out the restaurant on floor 12 our first morning. It was not too expensive (1500 Yen each) so we just paid each morning to eat there. Good selection of food and hot drinks. Nice view from the restaurant too. But they obviously lack cupboards and storage in this place as the restaurant had piles of tables clothes and things propped up along the window sills as you walk into the restaurant. Don’t expect that from a four star hotel as made it look untidy.I would not stay here again and would not recommend to friends or family. Our next trip to Tokyo I think I’ll go back to a well known hotel chain.

What a great hotel with fabulous roof top bar. Our room was small but we expected that however the design made best use of all the space.We used the coffee shop once & it was fine.I would definitely stay there again.

A pleasant walk from the Shinjuku station on a pedestrian path, the hotel is a welcoming oasis of green in the midst of the Love Hotel district. Inside, we found our rooms to be clean, small yet efficient. Having the loft was a great feature, although it didn't feel safe to put my (sometimes sleepwalking) son up there, i did sleep up there myself. I liked that there was a little place up in the loft to put down your book and a glass of water. My bed in the loft was very comfortable. It was great for our one night stay in Tokyo to be so close to Shinjuku station for our train out the next day. We didn't find the neighborhood to be as seedy as reported. Sure there were adult businesses but nothing too obvious and we felt perfectly safe walking around, even after dark. There was a lot of activity on the streets, with tourists, families and all sorts of people. People apparently come to this neighborhood to have innocent fun like karaoke and food, not just for "love". We actually enjoyed the excitement of Kabukicho, the neon lights, and all the excitement.We had no issues with noise. The location is very quiet.

Stayed three nights in one of the small designer rooms which had a queen bed. Big enough for us. Great location with easy access to the subway. The rooftop bar is great. Breakfast was ok. Would stay again.

This is a convenient and great hotel option in Shinjuku. The staff could understand English well and were very professional and helpful.The rooms were well equipped with good views of the city.The location was was ideal, within walking distance of sights like the Robot restaurant and Golden Gai.I enjoyed the vending machines on the lobby level which were very convenient.This is a great option in Shinjuku you will definitely have a pleasant stay here.

In the heart of the Shinjuku nightlife, this is a great hotel for basing yourself in Tokyo, a short walk to the JR and Subways, the breakfast buffet is great and staff are friendly. Wifi cut out little bits but no complaints at all. Rooftop offers a stunning view of Shinjuku, especially at sunset and if you are staying on particular side you can see a Spider-Man on a nearby roof (it’s the only photo of the room I took)

Stayed here for 4 nights in April during the cherry blossoms. Overall, cleanliness and service was what is expected of a hotel - they are going green which means you have to tell them in multiple ways you want your room made up and sheets changed which is nice. Ample vending machines on the first floor with bars/lounges in the upper floors for you to hang out and get a great view of the city. Location pros: close to train station (Higashi Shinjuku) which gets you on two of the major train lines in Tokyo so you can get there quickly or transfer easily as it is with all of Tokyo. A ton of restaurants/bars and "entertainment" options for you 24/7 so if you're suffering from jet lag then there's always something to do that is in walking distance. Now, if you're a little more shy and don't want some of that nightlife all up in your face (there are also hundreds of love hotels with the restaurants and bars) this (Shinjuku in general) might not be the best place for you to stay.

We stayed for four nights as our first stop in Japan: we were able to find the hotel easily in the dark, especially with it saved to our offline maps. It is just under 15 minutes from the main JR station. We did not have to go far in the evenings to look for food, and there was always something to do in the area. The only downside was the size of the room. I know this is typical to Japan, but space could have been utilised a bit better. We were near the cleaner's office and they were a bit noisy early in the morning - an easy fix though! Definitely go to the happy hour and soak in the view on the rooftop bar!

We stayed at this hotel for 4 days. It locates in a good area, close to subway stations. There are a lot of choices of food you can choose from. The room itself was clean and comfy. It has a window with a nice view. The staff was very friendly.We saw a look-like-spiderman figure on a roof top pretty far away from the hotel location. That's just a plus! :)

The location of the hotel is very convenient as it takes only about 5 minutes to the nearest subway station.The room was small yet practical and had all the necessities. We had a nice view to Shinjuku. The breakfast was good as it included both Japanese and western style food. We ate excellent pizza at the rooftop restaurant. The view from the rooftop restaurant was magnificent.Downside was that as we arrived, we soon noticed that we did not have towels in our room and we had to go and ask for them.

Love our room with the loft, room is small but big enough for me and my son. Hotel was very easy to locate from Shinjuku west bus station coming from the airport, we walked about 20 minutes with our luggage to the hotel, all the staffs at the hotel speak enough English to help. Hotel is nice and clean, street is busy but hotel located in a quiet location!

Had to make last minute changes to our reservations and unfortunetaly this hotel was the only choice, and a terrible choice it was.It's an absolute mistery to me why any one would voluntarily choose this hotel. For starters the location is right in the middle of the love hotel district in Shinjuku. The vecinity is not nice and I wish I had never experienced it. It's not what I want to remember of Tokyo. The lobby is small and seems to be a perpetual luggage storage facility and sleeping room for jetlag costumers. The corridors seem to be always a sheet and towel depot. The room was is the smallest room I have ever been in.Do not believe the hotel sites photos. That was my mistake! The rooms were supposed to look nice. Not at all. A capsule has more ambiance. Tiny tiny tiny room and a double bed. I had asked for a queen. Finally the attention at the front desk: horrible! Nothing to love about this hotel : Nothing! Even breakfast was lousy.

A great little hotel in a top location. Situated not far from the Higashi Shinjuku train entrance, and also to the main Shinjuku train station (which also houses multiple entrances to some HUGE shopping malls ie NEWoman, MyLord, Lumine etc) and plenty of places to eat and drink. Room was neat a tidy albeit very small (but to be expected in Tokyo) but great in-room amenities (tea/coffee etc). A great place to stay that’s convenient for all Shinjuku has to offer!

Comfortable and friendly hotel to begin our stay in Japan. The courtesy tea, water, soda and toiletries in the room were a welcome touch. I loved the soft nightshirt! Our room was very quiet with a nice view which was great to recover from a long day of sightseeing. Our room was immaculately cleaned each day and English speaking staff were very helpful. Recommend taking a cab to main station with your bags, otherwise nice walk to either nearby subway or longer Shinjuku station.

My husband and I stayed here for the first three nights of our Japan visit and this was the nicest hotel we stayed in. The hotel is in a great central location. It was immaculately clean and stylish. The staff were very helpful. Overall a great place to stay.

We stayed here the first 4 nights of our trip to Japan, and it was the most pleasant hotel we stayed in. The beds weren't futons and were comfortable. The staff was friendly, helpful, and spoke English well. Sitting in the rooftop bar at night with a cocktail, looking at the skyline was a relaxing way to end a day full of sightseeing.

The Shinjuku Granbell hotel was 100% fine; a decent place to stay in a central Tokyo neighborhood, with friendly staff and a welcoming vibe. I booked one of the smaller room types as I was traveling alone, and it was definitely small, but I gather this is somewhat typical for Tokyo hotel rooms. And it was a totally fine room, with a comfortable bed, clean and nicely accommodated bathroom, small desk/bench, and drawers. There is no lounge seating or closet.The location is convenient to the best of Shinjuku but felt perhaps a little seedy... it's close to Kabuchiko, which is the "red light district" while you'll find host/hostess bars and the Robot Restaurant. It certainly never felt dangerous or anything, but wasn't necessarily the nicest area in town.This property was a 100% acceptable place to crash between busy days in Tokyo, and felt like a very good value for the money.

Friendly, polite & helpful staff, Tokyo a typical, greet you as you arrive to check in, at this great place to stay. The rooms are classic compact & petite but very practical, cosy & warm. Well located, just 5mins from Korea "K" town & 15mins from Shinjuku central, this is a top spot 8-)

Generally speaking, there is nothing I’d complain about other than the size of the room, but this is to be expected in Tokyo. Everything was spotless. Very clean, comfortable beds, access to cell phone if needed, great location, good breakfast and friendly staff. Would stay here again.

Staff are friendly and room has all the amenities you would ever need!Location and a recommendation is why we picked it and the location is amazing! 5min walk to the centre of shinjuku and the metro!Amazing roof top bar serving good drinks and it has heaters for those cold evenings!Only downside is the room is quite small and I'm 6ft 2 and the shower is setup for someone who is well 5ft 2... HahaAlso very noisy peoole next door with kids... not the hotels fault but annoying all the same!Would 100% stay here again and would highly recommend!

We stay only for one night, comfort room, actually the district known as Red District (Shibuya) but we loved it, you could found many "late night show" nearby hotel. Love the breakfast. Specially i love the bathroom, japan hotels known always have a bathtub in the room (whatever the size was), and a big bottle of body shower, shampoo or conditioner.

Absolutely love everything about this hotel!Every single employee (from reception to housekeeping) has been nothing but lovely and helpful. Their English is amazing and they go out of their way to help you even if it isn't part of their job description. Currently staying in an economy double and it is fantastic! The vibe is great and really comfortable. The rooms are dead quiet. The roof top bar is also great and really good value (it cr@ps all over the "must do" Peak Bar at the Park Hyatt in every respect).As for concerns about the hotel's location i.e. being in the 'red light' part of town... well, you're far more likely to be randomly punched in the face waiting in line at a McDonalds in any Western country than you are to so much as encounter the stink eye from even the dodgiest of people in the vicinity of this hotel.

It is my first visit to Tokyo and not sure if it is normal to have such small rooms for a couple in a double room. Very tiny with limited space for luggage and moving around the room. The staff is friendly and pleasant.

Stayed here recently for 5 nights. Great location, close to Shinjuku nightlife and metro. Small room with a smaller window but that is typical of Tokyo. The complimentary smart phone is really helpful and the bed is comfortable. Terrible breakfast but good value hotel without the breakfast.

The Granbell Shinjuku was a pretty good hotel. Easy to find and close to the heart of Shinjuku which is an awesome and interesting place to stay. The rooms are VERY small but that is to be expected in Tokyo. It was clean and had a phone that we could use to get access to the internet when we were out and about which was super handy. The breakfast was pretty average so we just got stuff from Lawsons most days. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Grandbell and felt it was reasonable value for money.

Nestling just around Shinjuku Area, this hotel is a good place to stay. The busy shopping streets is just around the corner. The room is big and the interior is typical to a Japanese Hotel. The room is delicately clean and the brekfast restaurant got an excellent window view of the city scape from the 12F. But this hotel is not good for group tours, no bus can enter within its premise, you have to carry you baggage for at least 200m from the main road.

Good location, clean rooms, friendly staff.Check this out this might save some money - There was a iphone in my room which said complimentary for calls and browsing , i haven't used it, staff didn't mentioned anything about this complimentary phone and i didn't see anything on website.Bad room wifi, hardly able to browse anything on my phone or laptop, but wifi on lobby is better.

This hotel is perfectly located close to shopping and nightlife districts and situated close to both metro lines and train lines for easy access to more distant attractions. The rooms are on the smaller side, which is quite typical for Tokyo, but well appointed. Bathrooms are a decent size. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant on level 12 offers western and traditional options with great views of the city. Would stay here again.

Came here after staying in Seoul and was disappointed initially by the room, half the size of the one in Seoul for lots more money, and with a half bath that was unhelpful when we're both over 6 feet tall, shower clearly made for smaller people and not adjustable so had to bend all the time to wash. The hotel as others say is in a 'funny' part of town and looks like one of the few locally that didn't offer rooms to 'rest' in. Great location though as two minutes walk to Higashi Shinjuko station and we spent minimal time in the room. Very clean and facilities adequate, breakfast offers local food and international so always something to eat.Would recommend location and hotel if you don't mind the room size, we stayed in an economy double and in hindsight, you get what you pay for.

Had a great time staying here, rooftop bar nice way to end night and look over city. There is also a portable smart phone device that you can take out with you and it provides free internet access. Very handy to search things when out and about and use google maps. Also allows you to book discounted tickets (which we used for the sky tree) and has guides about different things. Room clean and all amenities provided. Easy short walk to stations.

Excellent visual info on the website on how to travel to this site from anywhere in Japan. We had a little difficulty communicating with the front desk reception over our 5 day stay but enjoyed our stay overall. Small but well appointed standard rooms with a very comfortable bed, great lighting (yay dimmers!), sitting area and interior design. Bathroom was large with a wonderful tub and electronic toilet. The room came with a "handy" or cell you could use as an electronic travel guide and take with you to roam around. The one thing I did not like was the narrow entry way with a hanger system for your jackets and shoes- kept knocking the clothes off the not-flat-enough-rack. We had an issue with one of the lights and after a day of inconvenience it was fixed - but I found it impossible to submit a complaint.

Loved the hotel, warm, clean, quiet in a fabulous location...would 100% stay there again on returning to Tokyo. It was easy to get to from Sjinjuku station and is positioned near to the incredible Golden Gai area... felt very safe and walked about day and night in area

Shinjuku Granbell Hotel is close to stations so when travelling to and from the airport this makes life a bit easier especially if you are taking all youre luggage with you. The hotel is very clean with good facilities, it is close to restaurants, the samurai museum, convenience stores and just 5minutes away from the golden gai. If you are travelling by train i would recommend getting off at the Higashi Shinjuku station as its only a couple of mins away.

We stayed here 2 nights and the location was perfect. Short walk to everything but not in the loud bustling part of Shinjuku so was quiet at night. We carried suitcase and a large snowboard bag to and from the JR no problems. Yes it’s the “red light district” but never saw anything dodgy and felt 100% safe day and night. I think people make it out to be worse that it is, it’s just a bunch of love hotels. The room itself self was an economy double and was fine for what we needed and had a nice view. Fitted our luggage and bathroom was good too, even had a bath. The only thing was a solid light fitting that drops off the roof and we were constantly smashing our heads into it (I’m only 5.7) and cause the room is on the smaller side was hard to avoid it. But other than that great stay

I had an amazing experience staying here. The rooms were pristine! So clean! And the service was excellent. The staff were extremely helpful in answering all my questions and providing me with reservations for shows, and restaurants. It was my first time in Japan and it did not disappoint. The room was a little small, but I was traveling solo so it was perfect!

Small but clean and modern room with decent sized bathroom (bath & shower)Location was perfect with many restaurants close by and the main station a 5-10 minute walk away.Restaurant served really good food and the roof top bar offered amazing views with a large range of drinks.Will definitely stay here next time we visit Tokyo.

After reading some of the negative reviews, I was a tad apprehensive about my stay at this hotel, however, my concerns were soon put to rest! Location wise, it's about 5mins from Higashi-Shinjuku and 10mins from Shinjuku which are perfect and very walkable. Granted that the hotel is on the fringe of the red light district, however, as a solo female traveller, I never felt unsafe at all. There are some really good restaurants nearby and a couple of convenience stores literally just round the corner which were my go-to places for my daily brekkie! My room was small but very, very clean, well decorated and very well-maintained. I had everything I needed so no complaints at all - my only gripe is that there is only 1 English channel on TV (CNN). Re: wifi, no comments as I brought my own router.Overall, I really enjoyed my stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

We stayed in one of the really fancy suites, and I loved it. If you stay for at least three days, the price per night goes down significantly, so I think it’s worth it. The outdoor bath is really nice. It was a little cold outside, but it was still an interesting experience. I actually like the regular bath more though.The view of Tokyo - especially at night - was really nice.

Would have given 5 but the WiFi was slow most of the time. Otherwise perfect hotel. Located within a great area for food and shopping, main Shinjuku station is 12 minute walk, other smaller stations are 5 minutes away, had breakfast at the hotel once and was pleased with the variety. Would return in the future. (Toilet seat is heated!!!)
user_name:
Michal P
Valley Stream, New York

review_body: A simple, no frills but very tasty place, easily located near the train station. Very small and cosy but there was no trouble getting a table in February!We had the fried squid, which was delicious! And shared the teriyaki chicken and sliced beef...both were delicious and definitely hit the spot after a mammoth walk around the lake earlier in the day.Would recommend and would return.

we booked two rooms for 4 adults in Jan. Rooms were very comfortable. We had been warned about the small room size prior, so were more than happy. The bed was comfy and the bathroom had all we required and more. The breakfast buffet was great. Both Asian and Western tastes catered for. The view from breakfast also allowed us to orientate ourselves in the confusion that is Shinjuku.The hotel is a short walk from Shinjuku Station, make sure you take the East exit! Check in and out easy, quick and friendly. As we arrived early they allowed us to store our bags securely, very helpful. The rooftop bar and happy hour made for a fun start to our evenings. If we ever find ourselves back in Shinjuku we would have no hesitation at booking into the Granbell.

First time travelling to Japan and we fell in love! We were in Tokyo for 1 week. Tokyo itself is an amazing city and we cannot wait to go back. We did our research and also confirmed based on the reviews. We knew that our money won’t go a long way, and expected hotels to be small: after all we were in Tokyo! Hotel is clean, great reception staff. We had a nice room with all amenities. It’s small! But manageable. We had our luggage stored up on a bench in the room and just squeezed our way around. The hotel offers a mobile to use called Beebot! This was so hopeful! We would add into the maps where we would want to go and follow directions straight away. We could also ask questions about where to go to eat, and the app chat window will give us answers right away! The only downfall would be the buffet breakfast could of been better, more options especially for the amount of people there: at times we would have to wait for bacon or fresh eggs. Location is central in a sense of walking distance. Not super close to the main strip, but it’s a little too busy so 5-10 min walk is not a big deal! Especially in the streets of Tokyo I felt so safe and comfortable.The rooftop view is gorgeous and the bar offers yummy drinks! When we come back to Tokyo will definitely stay here again.

The expectations were quite high. However the rooms too small made me a bit disappointed. We were 2 and stayed for about 10 days. Rooms were too small for 2 people and breakfast suitable for Chinese people only. Don’t think I will go back.

My family and I stayed here for a total of 6 nights to our disappointment. The rooms were small with little place to leave our luggages. The hotel was rated 4 stars but the services was more of a 2.5 star hotel. Hotel reception was good and helpful but services were not as delightful. Wifi connectivity is so bad at times in the night we couldn’t get any connection at all. This happened 4 out of the 6 nights we were here. Apparently if you leave your bottles behind in the trash the cleaners leave them there and expect you to clear them yourself. I shared a bottle of Choya with my family and left the bottle in the trash once I’m done. Funnily enough the bottle was in the room walkway when we returned. This happened 2 days in a row. Instructions that came with the key card said that we could request room cleaning services till 2pm. We left the hotel at 11am (slightly later than the usual 9am) as my daughter was unwell. Cleaners were not happy to clean our room saying that it was “too late” and I had to reason with them to clean the room to their unhappiness. What a shame as Japan is well known for being a polite nation. I stayed in many hotels all around the world during my travels and this was by far one of my worst experience ever. Would not come back here.

It has been quite a popular hotel recently. I like the modern design, but the rooms are way too small. I understand this is Tokyo, but with this price, I have tried some better choices. The location was good considering you take metro to Higashi Shinjuku, which takes less than 10 mins walk. From JR station it will take 15-20 mins. But I still like the location because in Kabukicho you will never get bored.

The hotel is located in the “bad” neighborhood of shinjuku and pretty distant from the subway station - 15 min walking , room is small, and the stuff at the front desk isn’t helpful. Good things- Room is clean and the rooftop bar is nice.

This was our first hotel on a two week trip, and it was quite good. Room was quite modern and clean. Staff was friendly and location convenient, since it's a walking distance to the JR station/restaurants/nightlife. There was some noise from the street traveling up to our room during the night, but earplugs helped and we slept ok here.This is my third time in Japan so I've gotten used to the small room size - no complaints on that. Room layouts are quite functional in this hotel, and if you're not traveling with 3 suitcases per person you'll be just fine. Other reviews have complaints about this being on a dodgy area and surrounded by love hotels. We however didn't feel unsafe walking around here during late hours. We knew before booking what kind of an area Shinjuku is, so this was not a surprise.

I left a box of hard disc, which is quite expensiv,, in the room after checking out. 4 days later I checked in again, and they told me that they didnt find anything in the room. I spoke to the manager, he just showed me an innocent face and did nothing at all to find my disc. He just stood there listen to what I'm saying with unreacted face.After all its all our fault that we left our thing inside the room, but met somebody with a level manager that didnt show any good intention to help us find our disc, definitely made us a little bit angry.

My husband and I decided to stay in the Designer room for our anniversary trip. The size of the room is perfect, the amenities are great. Expect, the windows of our rooms are right next to the restaurant's patio area, the people from the restaurant can clearly see inside our room from the windows. We have to keep our windows shut the whole time. I think this is very lamed because the bathtub decided to sit next to the window so you are able to enjoy the view while taking a nice bath. We can't even open the window due to privacy reason for our whole staying :/ Also, please check the bathrobe before you use it. Although it wrapped with the plastic bag so it looks like it's clean. I found an unknown hair stick on the robe, it was pretty gross. We paid a lot extra for a better room, we thought that the room should be much cleaner. I guess we are wrong. I would only recommend this room if you don't care about the cleanliness of the room.

Let’s start with the positive:Location is great, you can walk to the main shopping street within a few minutes and have the famous ‘golden gai’ Bars right in front of the hotel. The views from rooms is awesome!! Unfortunately that’s about it for the positives. We booked a ‘mature designer luxury room’ which was spacious but the only cool part of this room category was the bathroom - the living/bed area was quite ‘used’ and not really nice. I mean you pay around 300+€ a night and expect a bit more than a cool bathroom and a nice view. And here’s the worse thing about this hotel: the service. It’s actually like a hostel, they don’t give a XXXX about you as a guest. The ‘club lounge’ is terrible, there’s juices, and that’s about it. Between 3 and 5pm you get wine but have to ask for more every time the one wine bottle is empty, what happens quite fast as it’s rather busy during ‘happy hour’. View is nice though. Snacks are: chips and Japanese crisps - and that’s all they offer. And please don’t expect WiFi throughout the building - it’s limited to your room, not even at club levels.Breakfast is not even worth mentioning. Quality of food is TERRIBLE (!), you have to queue for a seat for at least 15-30mins - and then you get the lowest level of food. It’s really bad! View is nice - that’s about it again. Oh, and please don’t forget that you’ve to put your stuff away yourself, so there’s no one cleaning up for you, or anyone else. Reception and complaints: even though they run a hotel in the capitol the english level of staff is bad. We did ask for the ‘manager on duty’ after seeing the room and they sent the guy who runs the 13th floor lounge, who didn’t understand at all what we were complaining about. So he hardly said sorry and that’s about it. No apology, nothing happened. Safe box didn’t work, aircon is in Japanese only it was boiling hot in the room when we arrived, the mobile device you have in most hotels in Japan which is your personal guide in the city didn’t work at all. No love for detail, it’s a mass hotel - hostel as mentioned before would be more suitable. Result and recommendation: if you are interested in a nice hotel, focused on service and have a good time for your 350€ a night in a decent room category - DONT DO IT!! You’ll be as disappointed as you can be, same as we are now. Happy New Year

I’ve been traveling around Japan with family (spouse and three single adult children the past weeks). So far, I’ve been most impressed by Shinjuku Granbell’s standard double loft style room. It is the most spacious of the rooms we’ve had, and instead of the typical matchbox style rooms offered in this country, one room can accommodate 3 adults. Perfect for families traveling together. (Pictures of loft-style rooms from the hotel’s website).I was pleased that when I approached towards the very modern facade of this hotel, its walkway was surrounded by trees which differed from the hotels nearby.The hotel is nearby Shinjuku’s livelier red light district, but one felt very safe as the streets are well-lighted and people are walking about at all hours of the day and night.It is also about a kilometre away from Shinjuku station, so it is convenient for those who need to go to travel for work or leisure.A perfectly pleasant stay! Highly recommended!

Spent 2 Nights at this hotel and it was a comfortable stay. Needed a hotel close by to the Shinjuku train Station, to catch a train at 8.30am. Once i got my bearings, its a 15 min walk to the station. We got a twin bed room, but admittedly the room was compact. Amenities in the toilet is very complete. The staff are very friendly, efficient and speak english very well. Its a 10 min walk out to The shopping area and excess to plenty of food.

We used this hotel just few days ago, stayed for 5 nights and it was a good experience. Hotel ameinities was enough, everything is complete for usage. Room cleaning was simple with instructions. They change just towels and sheets. No wipe down or vacuum which is ok, as we are not messy couple. Maybe not good idea for kids. Overall hotel is clean and new.Their wifi works great. Staff was helpful and friendly. Good location even though in red light district but safe. A 15 mins walk to the shinjuku station or there is another train station nearby which you can use but needing transit. What really complete this good experience is that they have a portable HANDY device which allows you to use data to do search on Google or Google Map. Can also make calls locally or internationally (selected countries) for free!. If they advertised this, I think the hotel will be very popular. I hope they will continue to provide this device. Will surely return.

We are glad we took the recommendations to stay at this hotel. The location was absolutely perfect (close to golden gai area and two convenient train stations), nice and welcoming staff (all English speaking) and clean (small) room. Highly recommend it!

Currently staying at this hotel, not sure the room type others booked but our room is very small for two adults and a small child. We asked to pay for an upgrade but the next available is their top PH suite. What is making me so angry about Granbell is that when we checked in last night I was alone with my child with three luggages and small bags, I asked the staff for some help to bring it to our room and they straight out and said they can’t do that!! So I had to drag my heavy luggages, bags, and my child up to our room by myself late at night. This is the type of reply you get with most of the staff here, so don’t expect any type of service. Again, room is small (with queen bed), not super clean (I actually did a huge wipe down bc the counter still had water stain all over it) and location is in the middle of love hotels (however safe.)

The hotel room was the largest one we stayed in during our trip to Japan. The breakfast room was very busy. The location of the hotel was a little further away from the metro than we had anticipated. Everything about this hotel was Ok.

The tangibles of this hotel are OK - good location, good rooms (some small, yet functional) but it is really mis-managed. The front desk staff is just horror. I had a 45 minute discussion right after check-in about the openable in-room-windows not being allowed to be opened - while it was really too warm in the room. I remember a gentlemen called "Fukoda" - if someone is so much missing the idea of customer service, why pay him to be at the front desk? When leaving, the request for a late check-out was ignored. When I e-mailed them 1 day after check-out, back in Singapore, about a card left in the room, they were just rude. Yes, this is a cheap hotel. However, for Japanese standards, Tokyo in particular, the service is just unacceptably bad.

The hotel has the worse service and parking location, the parking is outdoor and lock with a chain manually, we have to get to the front office to inform them whenever we need to take the car out or parking. How inconvenient especially in this cold weather. The staff was terrible and not helpful when she saw I was struggling taking down my luggage and my 6 years old. She repeatedly told me that the room charges did not include bell boy services (what?!!), it’s the worse excuses and comment coming from any hotel. I really wonder how they get rated as 4 stars.And lastly, the hotel room doesn’t look anything close to the pictures posted on the websites. We won’t recommend this hotel and won’t stay here anymore (we checked out the next day though we booked for another 3 nights).

We stayed at Shinjuku Hotel for 4 nights and had a great stay. The room (standard) is not big, but well designed so it works. The hotel itself it very well located: next to the metro and walking distance to the JR line, Golden Gai, restaurants, etc. During the weekend, Shinjuku is a very busy area, but the hotel is 1 block away from it so it is quiet enough. The rooftop's view is amazing and is free for guests. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Quite far away from JR Not suitable for single girl as it is quite danger when pass through red light area during night time back hotel Small room with reasonable priceHelpful reception staff In doubt of not changing bed sheet for 4 nights stay

Hotel room was quite OK, all necessary thinks were there and it was clean. Bed was a bit small though. Neighbourhood is not really attractive but also nothing really wrong and walking distance (14 mins) from Shinjuku Golden Gai and Shinjuku Station.Reception staff was largely a bit aloof, not really welcoming, felt like just a number to them. Only on the last day there was one lady who was more friendly and helpful. There is a nice rooftop bar, staff there was friendly. Breakfast was OK and also there the staff was friendly.

We had the loft double room on 12/f. Definitely much bigger and more spacious than the average hotel room in Japan. City view is nice and the room has everything we need. Note if you want to work the internet is slow.The location is about 10-15mins walk from JR Shinjuku station, a bit closer are metro stations. The hotel is very close to Golden Gai if you wanna grab a drink (very interesting area def worth checking out), their bar on 13/f is also a good place to hangout with nice view of the neighbourhood. Will definitely consider staying again for another trip.

My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Granbell at the start of our December Japan trip. The location was ideal, room and hotel amenities clean, comfortable and convenient and complimentary pocket wifi came in very handy for navigating the city. Would definitely recommend.

Rooms were very nice, a little small by US standards, but roomy by Japanese standards. Modern, affordable hotel, in the middle of an older section with many restaurants and clubs to visit. A short hike to the train station, and everything of interest in Shinjuku. Hotel staff was super attentive and jumped to help when needed. Breakfast was great and worth the added cost. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning to stay in the Shinjuku area.
user_name:
Albert Eugene B
ocala, Florida, United States

review_body: The hotel has modern amenities. The staff was nice. The daily breakfast had a huge variety. The best part was the nightshirts they provided for guests. I was the only one who used mine in my party but it was kind of cool in a retro way to wear an old fashion nightshirt to bed.

stayed here for a fortnight,perfect location 5 minutes walk to metro stations , 15 minutes to the center of Shinjuku.very helpful staffsmall comfy rooms , little hanging space for clothes but an amazing loo!

Family of 3 for a quick vacation in Tokyo. We stayed at a Standard Hollywood Twin. The two twin beds combined made it into a King which suited us perfectly. The room is small by US standards and had no closets but it was well equipped with a small ref, hot water pot, coffee / tea, small table with chairs, lots of electrical outlet. You also get two free water bottles per day. The bathtub was big, toilet had bidet and heated seats and they provided all the toiletries included toothbrush, shaver, comb, hair tie, and slippers. Breakfast buffet was included in our room and offered western and asian food. Loved the congee and fried noodles. My son loved the spaghetti. It saved us time trying to find breakfast before going to the various tourist sites. The hotel is about 5-10 minutes walk to several train stations. The closest was the Edo line which is what we took when we went to the Tokyo Metropolitan Gov't Building. The hotel is also close to 7-11, Family Mart and lots of restaurants which are open late. We took the Airport Limousine Bus from Narita. Unfortunately, the hotel is not a drop off point so we had to take a taxi from Shinjuku West Station. I would still recommend the hotel. The size did not really bother us much since it was just a place to sleep after a long day of walking.

I absolutely loved this hotel! My partner and I stayed in 3 different hotels during our stay in Tokyo and this by far topped them all, the interior was so nice, the room and bathroom was bigger In comparison to others and definetly had the luxury feel for an amazing price, the staff were extremely helpful and the roof top bar was pretty . The location was so convenient with only a short walk to the JR line and it was almost pretty much in the centre of Shinjuku! We were so sad when we had to leave and wished we had of booked there earlier!I definetly 100% recommend this hotel! Enjoy

Stayed here in July 2018. The location of the hotel was good, it was only a 5-10 min walk to the centre of Shinjuku. There were helpful resources in the lobby to assist tourists with travelling to the major attractions (e.g., Disneyland, Skytree etc.) and the staff were also very helpful with any questions you may have had. The room was small but that was okay for us considering that we spent most of our days exploring Tokyo. Air conditioning was 10/10 considering we visited in summer which is really really hot! Also, loved the array of vending machines with cold drink available in the lobby - again, perfect for the hot seasons. Would recommend.

This hotel is a little hard to find when walking from the train station, but once you become familiar with the area it is an ideal location. The area is quiet, but within an easy walk to Golden Gai and Memory Alley. Breakfast is excellent, with a great view of the city each morning. The rooms are small, but no more than other Japanese hotels. This is a very comfortable hotel in a convenient location.

We stayed in this hotel for the first 4 nights of our first trip to Japan, and were very happy with our choice. Location was quite convenient to transportation, restaurants and nightlife. Rooms are small by US standards, but were clean, well appointed and give sufficient space. Breakfast buffet was worth it, including both Asian and western options. Rooftop area has nice views. When back in Shinjuku I would return to this hotel.

I've stayed for a week there during New years holiday. It was a pleasant stay there. Room is small but that's typical size in Japan. Great hotel too. There's nothing I can complain about it. Staffs were also nice and helpful. The location is few hundred meters walk to Kabukicho and also close to metro stations.

Shinjuku hotels take some getting used to - many are hidden down back streets that in most cities you would avoid. Not so in Tokyo - Shinjuku Granbell is welcoming in all ways. Suites are generally small but well organised, comfortable and clean. The Granbell also has a nice breakfast offering at a top floor level with a view of the area.This hotel is a reasonable walk from the centre of Shinjuku; however, there is a station close by where you can travel to Shinjuku (central) and then go anywhere in Tokyo.We would consider this hotel again.

Good location. Red light district proximity wasn’t an issue. Stayed in the luxury room - which was a good size for my wife and myself. I can’t comment on the smaller rooms, but based on approximate size information I found on booking.com - would be too small for my standards. Wifi is non existent - which isn’t really acceptable in this day and age. Thankfully we rented a pocket wifi and used that. Bebot concierge was the real star - we made a lot of restaurant reservations on it; it was even able to change the time of a reservation I had previously made using another app!

We stayed at this hotel for four nights at the start of Japan trip. The room was small with little room for two cases, but we found it comfortable nonetheless, especially for a short stay. The bedroom was pretty modern and the bed really comfortable. Shower was great and powerful. Everything was very clean and traditional Japanese bedwear was left out as well. The absolute best thing was the mobile phone you get called 'Handy'. It has wifi on it and you can take it out and about with you for maps and recommendations for various things. It was absolutely amazing to have this at the start of the trip so we could work out way around Shinjuku - we felt lost without it when went other places! Staff were very lovely, and another highlight is the rooftop bar - what a view! We went up during daylight and enjoyed cocktails over dusk and into the night, totally stunning. As a guest at the hotel you also don't have to pay the bars 1500yen (£10 GBP) cover charge and their happy hour runs until 8 o'clock making beers very cheap! In my opinion, this hotel was very cheap for how nice it was, so as long as you don't mind a small room you'll be fine! We were a five minute walk to the main area of Shinjuku and a fifteen minute walk to Shinjuku station - it was perfectly located for lots of things.

The hotel was not what had I expected in Japan. The receptionist that signed us in did not smile at all frowned the time - VERY UNFRIENDLY. The rooms was small - VERY SMALL. When I signed in I questioned the receptionist about wifi password- she said wifi password is in the room. There was a password, but wifi does not work - when I questioned the receptionist she said wifi does not work- NO WORKING WIFI. Handy phone they gave - I had to change it 3 times before it worked. This should not be rated as a 4 star hotel- it was more like a 2 star.Location, NOT GOOD, far and unsafe to walk inNEVER going back there.

I came here for business. Big mistake- no working wifi and they don’t care about it either. Beyond belief!The also messed up my prior booking, which cost me an extra 100E. An honorable host would have mentioned that on the website and to booking.com. They choose not to. For months already. Should give a clue about the type of ppl we’re dealing with...

I was hesitant about booking a hotel in Tokyo because I feel like it is really hit or miss. I had been looking at the Shinjuku Granbell for a while and figured if we didn’t book a standard room and went for the suites, it would be fine. Well it was honestly just average at best. First off, the hotel is on a small side street and does not have a drive up area for taxis or even a doorman. I thought this was a four star hotel but maybe I am mistaken. You have to get out of your cab on the side street and walk up this winding path to the front. When we arrived there were tons of suitcases in the lobby roped off - not sure if this was because of an event or something? There were a ton of people congregating in the lobby just sitting in the chairs and even sleeping at 2PM on a Wednesday. It just gave me a weird vibe. The hotel WiFi was out when we were there for the entire time. Not sure how the WiFi could be out the entire time but they provided a Handy phone in all the rooms that you were supposed to use. We had a pocket WiFi so this was not an issue. However, another disclaimer they write on their WiFi login is that it should only be used for email checking and web browsing not streaming videos. So take that into consideration if you are planning on staying here and using the WiFi. The hotel is HUGE and only has three elevators so it took forever to get up and down when coming or going. Guests would also cram into the elevators - most of the time the elevators would beep because there were too many people on them. Super frustrating when you are just trying to get up to your room.We booked a deluxe designer room casual and the room was okay - just a bit dated. The room was a good size as well as the bathroom. There were scuff marks all over the walls as well. The view was great - and the toiletries they provided were better than expected. The shower didn’t get as hot as I wanted it to but other than that no serious complaints. We did have a weird encounter with room service at 9am when they knocked on the door trying to clean the room. We didn’t have a sign out so probably our fault but it was still early. Another thing to note is there is NO GYM in this hotel. I would have thought that as such a huge hotel that has a variety of room types they would have some kind of fitness center, but nothing is here.We had breakfast included in the room rate and it was meh. We went down the first day late and were not super into it. Everything is on hot plates and it is just a standard buffet offering. I would skip it and eat something in the surrounding neighborhood. All in all, the stay was average at best, I feel like online it is a little misleading about the hotel experience. Still, it is a good price for what you get - I would just rather pay for a standard room at a nicer hotel than get a suite at the granbell.

First of all, there was no internet for whole my stay as 5 days. I asked receptionist that there is no internet in my room and they replyed yes there is no internet and giggling with their receptionist within japanese in front of me. they didnt make any solution and acted like out of their mind. Secondly, i gave the shopping bag after I checked out my room to give my another roommate however they forgot to give one of the thing which I gave all together. lastly, the location is surrounding by LOVE HOTEL (motel) and very dangerous to walking around at night.This is my first writing about reputation in my life, I am very very disappointed. I would neverever going this hotel.

Located in the hearth of Shinjuku zone in Tokyo, bearing in mind the huge area of the city, this hotel allows you to walk from its location to the main attractions in Shinjuku, besides, to the other places it is near to the metro station to go to those hot spots and shrines not close to walk. The facilities of the hotel are really comfortable, as the rooms, with the restaurant and bat on the top floors, offering a wide variety of dishes, all of them delicious and for all kind of tastes. The breakfast is really large on the choices to get. Many places, restaurants and bars around, as well, as convenience stores.

This was a really nice hotel. Very central to everything. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were cleaned every day and there was a lovely coffee shop in the reception area if you wanted to have a cup. Would definitely stay here again or recommend it to anyone visiting Tokyo. It was also spotless.

Excellently located in central Shinjuku, with several stations nearby giving easy access to any area of Tokyo. Room is small, but certainly in line with other hotels we stayed in, in both Tokyo and other parts of Japan, and was exceptionally clean and not too much of a squeeze even for two adults and four suitcases.Location aside, the other best thing about the hotel is, undoubtedly, the smartphone provided with the room that you can take out with you during you stay. With how big Tokyo is and unusual road signs in Japan generally, this was a life-savour for getting around and meant that we didnt get lost at all during our stay despite extensively using the vast metro system!Staff seemed fine and we certainly helpful in assisting us with getting a taxi to Tokyo station when catching an early Shinkansen to Hiroshima (around £20 to for reference, and £50-£55 from Haneda airport).

Hotel ok rooms nice ... some staff nice some a bit disinterested ... supposedly 4 star hotel . No wifi at all in rooms we were there for 5 days they kept telling us wifi would be fixed , but the simple fact is they just don’t have proper wifi .. if we wanted to use wifi we had to sit in lobby in o e particular spot many guest were unhappy . We were there on business so it made thing very hard and did spoil our stay ... in this day and age you would think a place like this would be up with tecnology . They better get their act together for Olympic Games in 2020. E commerce in Japan is wAy behind web sites confusing out dated . Wifi access for tourist is bad. When complained to staff at front desk they said they gave lots of complaints .. and was told management won’t care . To their credit they did give us 10% off our bill. We had to buy SIM cards and continue to top them up which was always convoluted .... and costly. I

Hotel is situated right next to male/female hostess bar district + other hotels offering hourly rates! However this did not feel threatening at any time and it was a great base for Shinjuku and very close to robot restaurant + VR zone etc.It was just 10-15 min walk from main station for transport links.Clean but small room . Comfortable bed. Tea/coffee making in room. Good shower + toiletries provided.Breakfast hit and miss - usual buffet style .Reasonable selection of cooked items but Poor value for money if like me you prefer toast/pastry style breakfast. Choice of “continental “ pastry items underwhelming. Margarine/jam combination packs (yuck) - no butter. No English tea but earl grey, peppermint etc available (strange cos English breakfast teabags supplied in room tea/coffee supplies)Roof top bar (usual hotel prices) was nice with city skyline views. Reception area small and oppressive - a place to meet up in but not to linger.My main bugbear was the non existent wi fi - utterly inadequate/frustrating even in main reception area.

It was good to stay here for short time. It located in Shinjuku where you can walk around, explore many local things, night market. The room was very good, clean, nice view. The buffet breakfast was ok, not many choices but delicious. I like to enjoy my time outside of hotel, many comfortable chairs. I love the way they design the room. Internet was very slow, disconnected many times.

Room is tiny and far from Shinjuku station. Reception staffs have attitude problems. They are impolite and when you request for a higher floor room. Their answer to you is "can you wait or not?" Checking out was not a pleasant experience as well. When you tell them the room which you are staying in. They will tell you "I know, can you wait?". Even retriving the luggage from the reception was not fun as well. They basically roll the luggage to you without pushing it over. Over all the reception staffs have attitude problems and needs to attend customer service lessons. I have stayed in Gracery Shinjuku back in 2015 and they have better service, larger rooms and nearer to the train station as well. I should have paid abit more and book Gracery Shinjuku for this trip.

We stayed in the luxury designer double mature room for a week. + The room was clean, the bed was much larger than we were expecting which was great, the shower was really big and had a rain shower head which was really powerful! The bath was a good size and we really appreciated the complimentary amenities in the room including different types of bath salts. The room had 2 large windows one by the bath one by the bed the view isn’t special. - The room lacked practicality if you are staying more than one night as it has one tiny cupboard that fitted one coat and one shirt in and that’s it! No chest of drawers to put your clothes away in etc, the hotel also advertises that you can do laundry but there is 2 washers and one dryer for the whole hotel so this wasn’t possible as it was in constant use- Throughout the week on occasion our fresh linen and towels provided after the room was serviced smelt questionable. The hotel is in the red light district and perhaps some of the clientele only visit to ‘rest’...- Breakfast definitely isn’t worth having at the hotel, I’d recommend finding somewhere in Shinjuku instead. Overall we had a pleasant stay at the granbell and we were impressed with the rooms cleanliness and luxury elements. One thing that I would say would have been helpful was to be issued a map of the area when checking in and been given a little information as check in was simply here’s your room key, and hotel policy.

Location is okay- close to a train station but not my favourite area of Shinjuku.No internet when we stayed - definitely inconvenient but they provide ‘handy’ phones for guest use.Rooms average size with no view

Came here for a week of work. Seemed a decent hotel but upon arrival laminated cards are on the reception stating no internet. Temporarily down. After talking with the two different staff, they confirm WiFi has been down for over a month. Speaking directly with the manager, he says it has only been about two or three days quickly I realise that this management does not care. The manager has no idea when the repair would happen. Vague in knowing when it went down, vague in knowing if or when it would be repaired. I was giving a wireless router to get me through. I have a small company in Tokyo. If our WiFi goes down we have a repairman shows up same day to fix. There is no excuse here. This is a poorly managed hotel. Sorry. Oh by the way. Lovely coffee shop on the lobby. But guess what? They don’t open until 10am. You better sleep in.

the economy rooms are very very small so if you have 2 bags of luggage good luck - you cannot unpack as there is no place to put your stuff.The more expensive club rooms are beautiful with great views

Spent two nights here mid September with my teenage daughter and was so thrilled with the location and room quality - I couldn't have picked a better place to stay. The shower was fantastic and the toiletries provided were of a high standard. The view was wonderful and the beds very comfortable. Courtesy umbrellas were provided to guests during wet weather (it poured whilst we were there) and the vending machines in-house covered virtually everything. The staff spoke excellent english and went out of their way to explain transport options and places to go - they were very friendly. The bit that made it for us though was the location - perfectly positioned to everything in Shinjuku. We would definately come back and stay here

My husband and I loved this hotel! Super clean room, nice amenities (bathrobe, pjs, tea kettle, coffee, tea, water, wine, etc), comfortable bed and sitting area. We has access to the private lounge for snacks and drinks 24 hours. Laundry room was also a plus. Good selection of food for breakfast. Rooftop bar was lovely. Access to some very good restaurants, specifically Cha Cha Hana and Black Hole. Staff was efficient and helpful. Daily cleaning service was outstanding. Atmosphere was mellow and provided a quiet respite from the big city. Highly recommended.

We were very pleased that we were able to check-in a little early after a long day. We booked a Superior Designer Double room which provided us with a nice living area with bar fridge, a blue tooth speaker and wine with glasses if you wanted indulge. The room was very clean and modern and exactly as shown on their web site. We loved the central location of this hotel and the Bebot GPS device provided by the hotel. Having the GPS was invaluable and saved us time finding our way around as we became oriented with all the streets and lane ways. The staff on the roof top deck worked very hard to satisfy everyone visiting this superb venue. Be sure to take advantage of this hotel facility. The front desk staff were very helpful in providing a extra device to enhance the wifi signal and call to reserve airport transportation for us. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed at granbell in September for 4 days and was very impressed with the location, the hotel itself and most importantly the staff who took time and effort to make sure our stay was as comfortable as possible, especially the lady on the reception who arranged our wake up call and taxi at 5am .,the hotel has a fantastic lounge on the 13th floor with friendly staff and superb views, I'd definitely recommend this hotel to any type of traveller
user_name:
pgardner1971
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: 2 x 3 night visits to the Grandbell Hotel, so i gave it a pretty good run. It’s located on the edge of the Shinjuku red light district, but didn't present a problem for me - it was easy to skirt around the seedy parts.
